title: Peru Balance of Trade
description: Peru recorded a trade surplus of 689 USD Million in September of 2022. Balance of Trade in Peru averaged 135.80 USD Million from 1957 until 2022, reaching an all time high of 2064.40 USD Million in November of 2021 and a record low of -676.30 USD Million in January of 2014. In 2017, Peru recorded a trade surplus for the second consecutive year, mostly due to a rise in shipments of minerals like copper, gold, zinc, lead, iron and silver. Peruâ€™s main imports are: raw materials for industry, capital goods for industry and fuels. Main trading partners are: China (34 percent of total exports and 22 percent of total imports) and United States (11 percent of exports and 20 percent of imports). Others include: Brazil, Switzerland, Mexico, South Korea and India.
